
## Descripción

Class, take your seats! It's PRIME-time for a quiz... `nc jupiter.challenges.picoctf.org 18821`

## Solución

Inicio conectándome al reto.

Observo que se despliega un cuestionario, el cuál evalúa si dominamos la terminología de RSA. Previamente analizamos el tema junto al profesor.

```
RSA - llave publica - asimetrico
-------------------------------------------------------------------------
m   - mensaje original o mensaje en texto plano 
c   - mensaje cifrado (ciphertext)
p,q - son dos numeros primos distintos y muy grandes
n   - es el modulo (lo compartes las llaves publica como privada)
tn  - totient n (funcion de euler)
e   - llave public - 65537 (exponente)  2 ^ 16 + 1
d   - llave privada

Calculos
--------------------------------------------------
n  = p * q
tn = (p -1) * (q-1)
d = e ^ -1 (mod tn)	- pow(e, -1, tn)

Cifrar  
--------------------------------------------------
c = m ^ e (mod n)	- pow(m, e, n)

Decifrars
--------------------------------------------------
m = c ^ d (mod n)	- pow(c, d, n)
```

Simplemente seguimos los 8 ejercicios que se nos presentan, intentando realizarlo rápidamente para que no se nos desconecte y tener que volver a ingresar las respuestas.

- Ejercicio 1
```bash
#### NEW PROBLEM ####
q : 60413
p : 76753
##### PRODUCE THE FOLLOWING ####
n
IS THIS POSSIBLE and FEASIBLE? (Y/N):y
#### TIME TO SHOW ME WHAT YOU GOT! ###
n: 4636878989
Outstanding move!!!
```
Si es posible, calculamos n a partir de p y q.
```bash
┌──(kali㉿kali)-[~]
└─$ python3
Python 3.13.7 (main, Aug 20 2025, 22:17:40) [GCC 14.3.0] on linux
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> q = 60413
>>> p = 76753
>>> n = q * p
>>> n
4636878989
```


- Ejercicio 2
```bash
#### NEW PROBLEM ####
p : 54269
n : 5051846941
##### PRODUCE THE FOLLOWING ####
q
IS THIS POSSIBLE and FEASIBLE? (Y/N):y
#### TIME TO SHOW ME WHAT YOU GOT! ###
q: 93089
Outstanding move!!!
```
Si es posible, calculamos q a partir de p y n.
```bash
>>> p = 54269
>>> n = 5051846941
>>> q = n // p
>>> q
93089
```


- Ejercicio 3
```bash
#### NEW PROBLEM ####
e : 3
n : 
##### PRODUCE THE FOLLOWING ####
q
p
IS THIS POSSIBLE and FEASIBLE? (Y/N):n
Outstanding move!!!
```
No es posible calcular p y q a partir de e y n.


- Ejercicio 4
```bash
#### NEW PROBLEM ####
q : 66347
p : 12611
##### PRODUCE THE FOLLOWING ####
totient(n)
IS THIS POSSIBLE and FEASIBLE? (Y/N):y
#### TIME TO SHOW ME WHAT YOU GOT! ###
totient(n): 836623060
Outstanding move!!!
```
Si es posible, calculamos tn a partir de q y p.
```bash
>>> q = 66347
>>> p = 12611
>>> tn = (p -1) * (q-1)
>>> tn
836623060
```


- Ejercicio 5
```bash
#### NEW PROBLEM ####
plaintext : 6357294171489311547190987615544575133581967886499484091352661406414044440475205342882841236357665973431462491355089413710392273380203038793241564304774271529108729717
e : 3
n : 
##### PRODUCE THE FOLLOWING ####
ciphertext
IS THIS POSSIBLE and FEASIBLE? (Y/N):y
#### TIME TO SHOW ME WHAT YOU GOT! ###
ciphertext: 
Outstanding move!!!
```
Si es posible, calculamos el cifrado.
```bash
>>> m = 635729417148931154719098761554457513358196788649948409135266140641404444\
04752053428828412363576659734314624913550894137103922733802030387932415643047742\
71529108729717
>>> e = 3
>>> n = 291294636093263225595211231362220787805854512081491385477991210836223332\
50646678767769126248182207478527881025116332742616201890576280859777513414460842\
75404565109359325172678549936082823789758627806841987551754301354536987170415971\
81053546908027266457106990299367542656543819296504943836225831740758057977666851\
92325859982797796060391271817578087472948205626257717479858369754502615173773514\
08743750453299414263220790650107983503705279730669089160055932167392894315851464\
65728859868810165696473578915985458803042361455480595208981331420875453691798760\
65657214225826997676844000054327141666320553082128424707948750331
>>> c = pow(m, e, n) 
>>> c

```


- Ejercicio 6
```bash
#### NEW PROBLEM ####
ciphertext : 
e : 3
n : 
##### PRODUCE THE FOLLOWING ####
plaintext
IS THIS POSSIBLE and FEASIBLE? (Y/N):n
Outstanding move!!!
```
No es posible calcular el texto descifrado.


- Ejercicio 7
```bash
#### NEW PROBLEM ####
q : 
p : 
e : 65537
##### PRODUCE THE FOLLOWING ####
d
IS THIS POSSIBLE and FEASIBLE? (Y/N):y
#### TIME TO SHOW ME WHAT YOU GOT! ###
d: 
Outstanding move!!!
```
Si es posible, calculamos d.
```bash
>>> q = 920920768058925337397247226026686758406710930085202415481919142153998240\
20372076186460768206814914423802230398410980218741906960527104568970225804374404\
61261773657928695986528722653869291137650793425684445633323636266987934707375623\
8894784951597211105734179388300051579994253565459304743059533646753003894559
>>> p = 978467753123928010372243969770126158484331996401057861197570470987579982\
73009741128821931277074555731813289423891389911801250326299324018557072727051765\
54711551479133757875885980389017315327725232649606247638949801982135846543339833\
8364421624871010292162533041884897182597065662521825095949253625730631876637
>>> e = 65537
>>> n = p * q
>>> d = pow(e, -1, tn) 
>>> d
634657553
```


- Ejercicio 8
```bash
#### NEW PROBLEM ####
p : 
ciphertext : 
e : 65537
n : 
##### PRODUCE THE FOLLOWING ####
plaintext
IS THIS POSSIBLE and FEASIBLE? (Y/N):
```
Si es posible, calculamos m.
```bash
>>> c = 134332909496805323740138674412631546347058150373827893419479050255739059\
74395028146503162155477260989520870175638250366834087929309236841056522311567941\
47420916355968775576223292653991090932683416897356061098609074443508157204792636\
44796294143997019204410916260468614934652141975266501466690095903602423753130960\
62285541413327190041808752295242278877995930751460977420696964385608409717277431\
82176540246151563968653790479908468255353046061151925187246383742506895899204216\
65073735568393770456168662212389323323909304049932423510713929659457183085042314\
68783743378794612151028803489143522912976113314577732444166162766
>>> e = 65537
>>> n = 239529373526435274513792275164283777050048945085663043131778801916621770\
61878993798938496818120987817049538365206671401938265663712351239785237507341311\
85838362893218308314561469658541192166299207837610399080698925728947259090216745\
73028881982931353330837345041919109532382788609231537462615007594116202998643951\
58783509535039259714359526738924736952759753503357614939203434092075676169179112\
45262068773167053490606984596563345574860664906239429328996705934814320660076582\
00213926082705288562383068491911132413558423963252101323580466163129013379874644\
73799040762271876389031455051640937681745409057246190498795697239
>>> p = 153143042272527868798412612417204434156935146874282990942386694020462861\
91806868456128176357703470660060838769914807101519472553339412606982685718242866\
04278182773787249775543659102315248272581609044937747487490884773282048121719359\
87088715261127321911849092207070653272176072509933245978935455542420691737433
>>> q = n // p
>>> tn = (p -1) * (q-1)
>>> d = pow(e, -1, tn)
>>> m = pow(c, d, n)
>>> m
14311663942709674867122208214901970650496788151239520971623411712977120527163003942343369341
```

Al calcular m obtenemos la cadena de caracteres que corresponde a la bandera en hexadecimal. La convertimos a caracteres de la siguiente manera:
```bash
>>> bytes.fromhex( hex(m)[2:]).decode()
'picoCTF{wA8_th4t$_ill3aGal..oa2d2239b}'
```


## Notas adicionales

- En [criptografía](https://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criptograf%C3%ADa "Criptografía"), **RSA** _(**[Rivest](https://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ronald_Rivest "Ronald Rivest"), [Shamir](https://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adi_Shamir "Adi Shamir") y [Adleman](https://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leonard_Adleman "Leonard Adleman")**)_ es un [sistema criptográfico de clave pública](https://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criptograf%C3%ADa_asim%C3%A9trica "Criptografía asimétrica") desarrollado en 1977, que utiliza [factorización](https://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Factorizaci%C3%B3n "Factorización") de números enteros. Es el primer y más utilizado [algoritmo](https://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Algoritmo "Algoritmo") de este tipo y es válido tanto para cifrar como para [firmar digitalmente](https://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Firma_digital "Firma digital").

## Referencias

https://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/RSA
